name: City Center Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: City Center Hotel was located perfectly! It is very near the bus station for Iceland Excursions so our trips to the Golden Circle and Blue Lagoon were very easy. The hotel was clean, the staff was very friendly (especially the night clerk!) and very helpful. We had free wifi. We were within walking distance of the water, shopping, and everything. This was our first trip to Iceland and I recommend staying here for anyone!
reviews.title: Great location very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a good location, if you want to be really downtown. But it comes with a cost... Its in the party street in Reykjavik, and people party and yell just outside. If you have a room out to this street, and on lower level, forget about sleeping! If you have a flight to Europe, you have to leave the hotel at 04:00am, and the party will still be on...
reviews.title: Location good, but it has a cost....

reviews.text: Many of the rooms are really small. The first we got almost had no room for luggage. Kept knocking my head in the tv on the wall when walked around the bed... beds was comfy though...
reviews.title: Great room, location and staff

reviews.text: Breakfast is not included, but you can buy it downstairs in a connected bar place, but they dont open before 07:30 or so, so if you are going on a trip in the morning - you wont make breakfast...
reviews.title: City Center Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would not stay here again next time. Will go for a more quiet location with breakfast.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel to Experience Reykjavik

reviews.text: Spent 3 nights here in a clean, large room with all the facilities. Massive shower room, toiletries provided and mega comfy beds with black out curtains - ideal at this time of year with only 3 hrs darkness each night!
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.text: The location is ideal in the city and all the tour operators call here for pick ups etc.
reviews.title: Amazing experience with accommodating staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar does a happy hour from 5-7pm at a very good price for a beer(500kr)
reviews.title: Can't beat the location

reviews.text: Breakfasts are very good with a huge range and run til 10am if you fancy a lie in.
reviews.title: Convenient Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in, a good hotel in a fantastic city
reviews.title: Great location, reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite its bland name (and one which is confusingly shared with other nearby hotels) this hotel offered something different. The rooms were large and comfortable and the front desk helpful and efficient. We particularly welcomed the breakfasts which were of good quality and quite varied. Excellent bread! Well worth the €10 each. Wonderful location (though you never too far from anywhere in this small city) I cannot fault this good-value hotel.
reviews.title: Ideal stay in the centre of town

reviews.text: I stayed here 2 nights and had no issues. The room was very clean and had everything I needed. Bed was very comfortable. Hotel is in a great location close to food and a small grocery store, nice and close to harbor. Price was reasonable as well compared to other places in the area.
reviews.title: Great location, clean rooms

reviews.text: We were day for few days. The price was very good for Reykjavik.
reviews.title: The place to Stay in Reykjavik

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location, cleanliness, staff was just excellent.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: recently traveled to Iceland with a group of about 30, we all stayed at City Center Hotel for the week, the hotel is right downtown, walking distance to many great restaurants, and bars. The whole week the entire staff were extremely helpful, they all went above and beyond to help us have an excellent experience in Iceland. Everyone was very generous and knowledgeable of the area. The hotel has a micro bar attached to it, and though I did not get to check it out they had a huge selection of beer from the looks of it. The breakfast the hotel is great, the gym is better than that of other hotels I have been to. Though the rooms might be a little small in most cases, most time was spent exploring beautiful Iceland, I would definitely recommend this hotel to those visiting Iceland.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff

reviews.text: Having never been anywhere in Europe, I honestly had no idea what to expect, but this hotel exceeded just about all of my expectations. The hotel is located in the center of the city and there's plenty to do within a 5 minute walk. Food, bar, night life, all a stone's throw away. As for the hotel itself, the service was excellent and the daily breakfast is better than anything you'd get in the US (where I'm from). The staff was more than happy to answer our questions and give us advice for things to do around town. If I were to go back to Iceland, I'd definitely stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great location, even better hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the City Center Hotel, though I think we were stuck with the smallest room in the hotel. It contained a king sized bed, and not much else. We had to file into the room one at a time in order to squeeze through the door. However, the room was very clean and the hotel was well located. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good. Next time we would ask for a larger room. One final thing: street noise can be a bit of a problem at night.
reviews.title: Smallest room we've ever stayed in.

reviews.text: We stayed at the City Centre Hotel for three nights as part of a long weekend to Iceland in June 2013. The hotel is unquestionably one of if not the best located Hotel in Reykjavik. The Hotel is situated right in the heart of Reykjavik high street with a number of restaurants (I would highly recommend Grillmarkadurinn and Café Paris in particular) and bars within the same street as well as the harbour and Harpa Conference Centre around the corner. The hotel staff were extremely accommodating, particularly in arranging pick up times for both Iceland Excursions and Reykjavik Excursions. Would definitely stay at the City Centre Hotel in all future visits to Reykjavik!
reviews.title: Excellent location and great value

reviews.text: I visited Iceland in march and stayed at the City Center. I really appreciated this hotel, both location and staff. I landed in Reykjavik before sunrise and showed up to the hotel well before normal check in. After heading out for a coffee and breakfast, i revisited the hotel and was told my room was ready for an early check in. Much appreciated after an all night flight. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Also a grocery store right across the street. City Center made a great home base in Reykjavik.
reviews.title: great hotel and experience

description: City Center Hotel is a new hotel located in the heart of Reykjavik, Iceland's capital. Standing 6 floors on one of the oldest streets in Reykjavik, Austurstraeti. City Center Hotel is a 3 star accommodation with individuality, location and personal service for all its guests to enjoy Reykjavik and Iceland. City Center Hotel has 30 rooms, with modern and classic amenities such as: free high speed wireless internet access, hair dryer, slippers, bathrobe, mini-bar, telephone, LCD TV with satellite and Pay-TV, radio, alarm clock, coffee & tea maker. All rooms have bathrooms with a shower or a bathtub. The hotel has handicapped facilities. Some rooms have great views over parliament square and some have balconies. City Center Hotel offers service to its guests like a small gym, lobby bar and a shop with Icelandic design and music.
